decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing the graveyard as a resource to quickly build a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of cards like Golgari Grave-Troll, Golgari Thug, and Prized Amalgam. By using cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Stinkweed Imp to mill cards into the graveyard, the deck can quickly bring back multiple creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The use of Force of Will and Force of Negation helps to protect the combo pieces and ensure that the deck can execute its game plan efficiently.

This deck focuses on playing low-cost, efficient creatures and using disruption spells to control the game. The goal is to put pressure on the opponent early while disrupting their game plan with counterspells and removal spells. The inclusion of companion Lurrus of the Dream-Den allows for additional value by being able to play certain cards from the graveyard. The deck also includes powerful card draw spells and mana acceleration to ensure a consistent and powerful game plan.

This deck focuses on using control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage and resource advantage. The deck utilizes a combination of counterspells, removal, and disruptive creatures to control the board while also using powerful card draw like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time to maintain card advantage. The inclusion of powerful artifacts like Time Vault and Moxen helps to accelerate the deck's game plan and outvalue the opponent. The deck aims to outlast the opponent and grind out a victory through superior resource management and disruption.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly through artifact acceleration, drawing cards efficiently, and creating a lock with key artifacts like Time Vault and Manifold Key. The goal is to assemble a winning combo by taking extra turns, controlling the opponent's resources, and disrupting their game plan. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value and recursion for the deck. Overall, the deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent through a combination of powerful spells and synergistic interactions.

This deck focuses on using a mix of counter spells, removal, and card advantage to control the game while utilizing powerful artifacts and tutors to assemble key combos and win conditions. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds a recurring threat to the deck. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while steadily advancing its own strategy, ultimately dominating the game through careful resource management and strategic decision-making.

The deck revolves around using powerful artifacts like Mana Vault, Grim Monolith, and Coveted Jewel to generate mana quickly and efficiently. The goal is to set up a combination of cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Phyrexian Metamorph to draw into key pieces like Tinker, Time Vault, and Ancestral Recall, allowing you to win the game in a single turn. The deck also utilizes powerful artifact lands like Mishra's Workshop and Tolarian Academy to further accelerate your game plan and overwhelm your opponent with a fast and explosive combo.

This deck focuses on utilizing the combo potential of Paradoxical Outcome to generate a large amount of card draw and mana acceleration. By utilizing efficient artifacts like Moxes, Black Lotus, and Sol Ring, the deck aims to quickly generate mana to cast Paradoxical Outcome to draw a large number of cards and potentially win the game through a combo involving Time Vault or other powerful spells. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds another layer of flexibility and resilience to the deck's strategy.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 combo deck revolves around utilizing Paradoxical Outcome to generate card advantage and mana acceleration. By combining powerful artifacts like Coveted Jewel, Mishra's Workshop, and Urza's Saga with mana rocks and card draw, the deck aims to quickly assemble a board state that can win the game in one explosive turn. The inclusion of cards like Tinker, Time Vault, and Karn, the Great Creator provide multiple avenues for victory, while disruptive spells like Force of Will help protect the combo. Overall, the deck focuses on generating a game-winning advantage through synergy and efficient plays.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combination of cards to generate huge amounts of mana and draw through the deck to find win condition cards like Time Vault. It utilizes artifacts and cards like Paradoxical Outcome to bounce key pieces back to hand and replay them for maximum value and efficiency. The deck also includes disruption and control elements to protect its combo pieces and stall opponents while setting up its win condition. Ultimately, the deck aims to outpace and overwhelm opponents with its efficient and explosive plays.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by playing hatebear creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Chancellor of the Annex, while also using disruptive artifacts like Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's spells through taxing effects and denial of resources, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Archon of Emeria and Seasoned Dungeoneer. The deck also includes mana acceleration in the form of Moxen and Ancient Tomb to quickly play out its threats and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on a fast and disruptive aggro strategy with a MUD archetype, utilizing cards like Phyrexian Revoker, Lodestone Golem, and Nettlecyst to disrupt opponents while deploying threats quickly with cards like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Patchwork Automaton. The deck also makes use of powerful artifacts like Mana Crypt, Moxen, and Mystic Forge to generate mana and card advantage. Additionally, cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine provide additional disruption, while Crucible of Worlds allows the deck to repeatedly use them. The deck seeks to overwhelm opponents with efficient creatures and disruptive plays.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through the use of hate cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Chancellor of the Annex, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like White Plume Adventurer and Boromir, Warden of the Tower. It aims to control the board with disruptive elements such as Wasteland and Cavern of Souls, all while maintaining a fast pace thanks to mana acceleration from Moxes and Ancient Tomb. The deck's strategy revolves around creating a hostile environment for the opponent's spells and creatures, ultimately overwhelming them with a strong board presence.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly through efficient spells and mana-producing artifacts, then using that mana to cast powerful combo cards like Tendrils of Agony or Bolas's Citadel to win the game in a single turn. It includes cards that can dig for specific combo pieces, disrupt opponent's plans with counterspells like Flusterstorm and Force of Will, and manipulate the top of the library for better draws. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and efficiently to overwhelm opponents before they can react.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and mana acceleration to generate large amounts of mana quickly, enabling the player to cast powerful spells like Paradoxical Outcome to draw cards and generate more mana. The deck also includes cards like Mishra's Workshop and Urza's Saga to search for key artifacts like Time Vault and Tinker, allowing for potential game-winning combos. The inclusion of cards like Force of Will and Trinisphere provides disruption and protection, while auxiliary cards like Grim Monolith and Mana Crypt further support the deck's fast and explosive playstyle.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents with hatebear creatures like Thalia and Chancellor of the Annex, while also utilizing aggro elements like Archon of Emeria and Seasoned Dungeoneer to pressure them. The deck also includes powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxen for ramp and acceleration. It aims to control the game by taxing opponents' resources with cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere, while also utilizing disruptive lands like Strip Mine and Wasteland. The deck's strategy revolves around combining aggressive creatures with hate effects to outpace and disrupt opponents in a Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

The main focus of this Vintage 1 vs 1 Bazaar Aggro deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug, then bring them back onto the battlefield with cards like Ichorid and Bloodghast. The deck also utilizes cards like Hollow One and Prized Amalgam to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Bazaar of Baghdad is key to both filling the graveyard and finding the necessary cards to execute the aggro strategy efficiently. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless assault of creatures.
